intro: Clematopsis speciosa, commonly known as the showy clematopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Clematopsis speciosa thrives in well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
